intro: Astragalus samamensis f. djashmensis, commonly known as the Samamensis Astragalus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky or arid environments, where it has adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features include a short stem, trifoliate leaves, and pods that contain small, rounded seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
